ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:0.2_0: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:0.5_0: The second training rule on not giving the full admission to trainee nuns
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.2_0: a trainee nun went to the nun Thullanandā and asked her for the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.3_0: Thullanandā told her, “If you follow me for two years, Venerable, I’ll give you the full admission.” But she neither gave her the full admission, nor made any effort to have her fully admitted.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.4_0: and she told them what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.5_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.6_0: “How could Venerable Thullanandā say this to a trainee nun,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.7_0: but then neither give her the full admission, nor make any effort to have her fully admitted?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.9_0: but then neither give her the full admission, nor make any effort to have her fully admitted?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.12_0: “... How could the nun Thullanandā say this to a trainee nun?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.13_0: but then neither give her the full admission, nor make any effort to have her fully admitted?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.14_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.15_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:1.16.1_0: ‘If a nun tells a trainee nun, “If you follow me for two years, Venerable, I’ll give you the full admission,” but she then neither gives her the full admission nor makes any effort to have her fully admitted, then, if there was no obstruction, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.6_0: one training for two years in the six rules.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.7_0: “If you follow me for two years, Venerable”:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.8_0: if you attend on me for two twelve-month periods.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.10_0: I shall give you the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.11_0: Afterwards she emerges on the Sabbath:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.13_0: She neither gives her the full admission:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.14_0: does not herself give her the full admission.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.15_0: Nor makes any effort to have someone else given the full admission:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.17_0: If she thinks, “I won’t make any effort to have her fully admitted, but she then by the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.20_0: if she searches, but is unable to find anyone to relinquish it to;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.22_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.24_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc78:2.25_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on weavers, is finished.
